newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian castor prices up as credit constraints end.
newsitem.headline: Indian castor prices up as credit constraints end.

text.p: Indian castor prices rebounded on Tuesday to 1,118/1,119 rupees from 1,111/1,112 rupees following Saturday's announcement that the central bank was lifting credit controls on several commodities, dealers said.
However groundnut oil fell to 395/397 rupees per 10 kg from 401/402 rupees on higher new crop arrivals of about 90/100 tonnes.
The Reserve Bank of India at the weekend announced its six-month credit package for second half 1996/97, in which several commodities were also benefited.
